title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.12.34 part 2 | 14-09-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: ओम अज्ञानति मिरान्दस्या ज्ञानान्जनिषलाकया चक्षरुन्मीलितं येनातस्मै श्री गुरवेनमहा नमा ओमिष्णु पादाया कृष्ण प्रेष्ठाय भूतले श्रीमते भक्ति वेदान्त स्वामिन्निति नामिने
नमस्ते सारस्वते देवे गौरवाणी प्रचारिने निर्विशेशा शुन्यवादी पाश्चात्यदेशतारिने जाय श्री कृष्ण चैतन्या प्रभूनित्यानन्दा श्री अद्वैत गणाधरा श्रीवासादी गौरवक्त वृन्दा
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Chai Vanarottamam
Devim Sarasvatim Vyasam Tato Jayam Udhirayet
In this session we will continue discussion of the 34th verse which we began in the previous session
of the 12th chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam
The verse I will just recite once again just to refresh your memory
Tenasamrita Sambharo Dharmaputro Yudhishthiraha Vajimedai Stribirbhito Yajnai Samayajad Harim
The meaning of this verse is by those riches the king could procure the ingredients
horse sacrifices thus the pious king Yudhishthira was very fearful after the battle of Kurukshetra
pleased Lord Hari the personality of Godhead
So continuing the purport if Maharaj Yudhishthira is a sinner in his daily discharge of duties
in royal administration of state affairs wearing the killing of man and animals is
Then we can just imagine the amount of sins committed consciously or unconsciously by
the untrained population of the Kali Yuga who have no way to perform sacrifice to please
So those days when people were very careful when they would indulge in killing whereas nowadays people are
not trained and the influence of Kali is such that they become indifferent to the sins they may commit
They are not worried about it but they have to suffer
Suffering cannot be avoided simply by being ignorant or claiming that I don't know that
I will be punished by doing something wrong
a proper specifically says here in Kali Yuga people do not have a way
becoming free from the sinful reactions
platform says therefore that the prime duty of the human being is to satisfy the Supreme Lord by the performance of one's occupational duty
सम्सिद्धि, सम्सिद्धि means the highest perfection, is simply possible by pleasing the Lord Hari.
So, should I proper further explain?
Let any man of any place or community, caste or creed be engaged in any sort of occupational duty,
but he must agree to perform sacrifices as it is recommended in the scriptures
for the particular place, time, and place.
time and person so the occupational duty per se does not matter so much but rather the people should perform recommended sacrifices and thereby become free from all reactions
in the Vedic literatures it is recommended that in Kali Yuga or present age people engage in glorifying the Lord by chanting the holy name of Krishna
in different places it is said
in glorifying the Lord by chanting his holy name
in the twelfth cant also it is told
the sacrifice of chanting the holy name of Krishna
that is what people have to do
one can be free from all sins
and thus can attain the highest perfection of life
by returning home back to Godhead
the highest perfection of life is to attain liberation
but that liberation is not possible if one does not
one can be free from all sins
and can also attain the highest perfection simultaneously
we have already discussed this more than once in this great literature in different places
especially in the introductory portion by sketching the life of Lord Sri Chaitanya Mahaprabhu
in the beginning of this Bhagavatam Srila Prabhupada has given a biography of Sri Chaitanya Mahaprabhu
people are generally not inclined to perform sacrifice
but Chaitanya Mahaprabhu has taught us
the Lord has declared openly in Bhagavad Gita
how he becomes pleased with us
and the same process is practically demonstrated in the life and preaching work of Lord Sri Chaitanya Mahaprabhu
for the sake of my pleasure
the perfect process of performing Yagna or sacrifice
to please the Supreme Lord Hari
the ways of Lord Sri Chaitanya Mahaprabhu
in this dark age of quarrel and dissension
so Chaitanya Mahaprabhu has taught a specific method of performing
the dark age of quarrel and dissension
those days people had lot of natural resources
somebody may not be able to offer
people of this age can hardly think of such performance of Yagnas
where will they get gold from
so much of gold that Yudhishthira Maharaj spent
so it is not practically possible
and Prabhupada makes a remark about the modern
at the present moment we have heaps of papers
and promises of their being converted into gold
by economic development of modern civilization
and still there is no possibility of spending riches
cannot spend the kind of money
now what Chaitanya Mahaprabhu is recommending
but he is not recommending anything
which is not in the scriptures
such a method requires no expenditure at all
what is the expenditure in chanting Hare Krishna
and yet can award more benefit
as a process of killing animals
you tell us not to eat meat
Now, Prabhupada says, animals offered for the yajna were rejuvenated to a new span of life by the transcendental power of chanting the Vedic hymns, the brahmanas who chant the mantras.

And by the power of the mantra, the animal which was sacrificed or killed in a horse sacrifice, that animal would be revived when the priest in the sacrifice would actually chant mantras, suitable mantras.
formerly they were killing animals for the sake of performing sacrifice, now they are killing animals for the sake of feeding the slaughterhouse.
But that is not the real proper understanding.
The Veda mantras are all practical and the proof is rejuvenation of the sacrificed animal.
So when an animal is killed for a sacrifice,
But reviving such an animal requires the power of the mantra to be chanted by duly qualified brahmanas.
And Srila Prabhupada says, there is no possibility of such methodical chanting of the Vedic hymns by the so-called brahmanas who preach of the present age.
So therefore, it is recommended to chant the holy name of Supreme Lord Hari and easy, inexpensive, effective way of doing sacrifice in this age.
I will stop here. Thank you very much. Hare Krishna.
